articles.description: January 13, 2026 3:40 a.m.   On Monday night, Roseburg Mayor Larry Rich delivered the annual State of the City address during the first council meeting of the new year. A city release said in the speech, Rich noted accomplishments in the past year – including urban growth boundary adjustments to allow new home construction and...

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: January 13, 2026 3:30 a.m.  State Representative Boomer Wright has announced his retirement from the Oregon State Legislature after 2026. The ninth district Republican has represented parts of Coos, Lane and Douglas County – including the Reedsport area, since 2020. In a release Wright said, “I thank all of you for the support, friendship, advice...

articles.description: January 13, 2026 3:20 a.m.  Umpqua Community College has announced that both the UCC Wooley Center and UCC’s Small Business Development Center have officially moved into the recently remodeled downtown Roseburg UCC building at 729 Southeast Jackson Street. A UCC release said the revitalized building features student housing on the upper floors, with the Wooley...
articles.title: COLLEGE ANNOUNCES WOOLEY CENTER/SBDC MOVE TO DOWNTOWN

The Roseburg VA Health Care System is reaching out to offer resources and support for all veterans who may be struggling, regardless of when or where they served. A VA release said the RVHCS is reaffirming its...
articles.title: ROSEBURG VA HEALTH CARE SYSTEM OFFERS HELP TO PREVENT SUICIDE

articles.description: A long-running youth media program aimed at amplifying teen voices is returning this February under a new name, but with the same mission that has guided it for more than a decade.

articles.description: Roseburg’s next geocaching series launches on Saturday, Feb. 7.
articles.title: Discover Roseburg Geocaching kick-off scheduled for Feb. 7

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Round Table Pizza is set to return to Roseburg this spring at 2040 NW Stewart Pkwy. FAT Brands confirmed the comeback and says the location plans to hire 25 employees. An exact opening date has not been announced.
articles.title: Round Table Pizza Set to Return to Roseburg This Spring

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County deputies are investigating a fatal two-vehicle crash on Elkhead Road near Drain early Jan. 14. An 89-year-old driver passed away at the scene. A 72-year-old driver was injured and taken to Mercy Medical Center. No intoxicants suspected.
articles.title: Fatal Crash on Elkhead Road Near Drain Under Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple enforcement actions on Jan. 15, including warrant and parole violation arrests, a DUII citation following a domestic dispute call, and enforcement activity in city parks, according to the department’s daily activity logs.
articles.title: Police Log: January 15, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Wildlife Safari is hosting Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18 and 19, offering free drive-through admission for county residents with valid ID. Discounts on encounters, memberships, plushies, retail, and food will also be available, along with keeper chats.
articles.title: Wildlife Safari Offers Free Admission for Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18–19

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: C&K Market announced it will close Ray’s Food Place in Drain in late February after “careful consideration.” The employee-owned company said all staff will be offered jobs at other locations, and gift cards and loyalty rewards will remain valid at all Ray’s stores.
articles.title: C&K Market to Close Drain Ray’s Food Place in Late February

articles.title: January 16, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Celebrate the Umpqua River Lighthouse’s 132nd birthday at a free open house Saturday, Jan. 17, 2026, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. in Winchester Bay. Enjoy refreshments and cake, tour the lighthouse from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., and explore the museum, gallery, and gift shop.
articles.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse to Celebrate 132nd Birthday with Open House on Jan. 17

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston Police arrested 21-year-old Lucas Brent Carr of Roseburg on 60 charges of encouraging child sex abuse in the first degree. Police said the case began July 16, 2025, after a tip from the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children. Carr is held without bail.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Jailed on 60 Child Sex Abuse Charges After Winston Police Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Elk Island Trading Group dismissed its lawsuit against the City of Roseburg, citing a possible path forward through changes to the Homeless Commission and a focus on Parker’s Place Village in Grants Pass, expected to open June 1, 2026.
articles.title: Elk Island Drops Lawsuit Against City of Roseburg, Citing “Path Forward” and Grants Pass Shelter Focus

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Jan. 14, including criminal trespass and warrant arrests, a vehicle break-in theft, weapons ordinance violations in the Greenway, and multiple non-injury crashes, according to the city’s daily police log.
articles.title: Police Log: January 14, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg residents are invited to volunteer Monday for the annual MLK Day of Service river cleanup and invasive species removal event. Crews will work in several city parks, with a 9 a.m. gathering at Stewart Park Pavilion.
articles.title: Community Invited to MLK Day of Service River Cleanup and Restoration in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg High School students will soon train on the Umpqua Community College campus after both boards approved a new partnership. The agreement creates dedicated space in UCC’s Medical Careers Hub, opening new healthcare career pathways for local students.
articles.title: Roseburg High Students to Gain Hands-On Healthcare Training at UCC Through New Partnership

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A multi jurisdictional training exercise simulating a train car hazardous materials incident will take place in downtown Roseburg on February 10. Residents may see increased emergency activity. This is only a drill and there is no threat to the public.
articles.title: Multi Jurisdictional Training Exercise Planned in Downtown Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police cited a 56 year old man after finding a fire burning inside a tent at a Deer Creek Park campsite. Officers also located a machete at the scene. The man was cited for prohibited burning and possessing prohibited weapons on city property.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Cited After Fire and Weapon Found at Deer Creek Park Campsite

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Jan. 13, including parole and warrant arrests, prohibited camping enforcement, littering near waterways, and traffic violations. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections following citywide contacts.
articles.title: Police Log: January 13, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The City of Reedsport Water Department announced a scheduled water shutdown affecting parts of the Crestview area on Thursday, Jan. 15, from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. A map has been provided showing impacted areas.
articles.title: Scheduled Water Shutdown Planned for Crestview Area in Reedsport

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County Sheriff’s Office reported results of enhanced DUII patrols conducted Dec. 10 through Jan. 1. Deputies made two DUII arrests, issued four minor in possession citations, and logged multiple traffic warnings as part of a holiday safety enforcement effort.
articles.title: Sheriff’s Office Releases Results of Holiday DUII Enforcement Campaign
